::Zardus::

Zardus taps a few buttons on his wrist comp as he recieves Nemesis' 
transmission, looking at the info.

"Hmm... Excellent ideas... The shields don't go down to the sea 
bottom, no. They stop at sea level."

He looks over at the CR tank as it raises FZ (future Zardus)'s body, 
now fully repaired. He hooks up some wires, tapping a few keys on a 
console to start up a program.

"The Iron Fist has materials and torpedos in store, as does the 
Alliance base, and I'm sure we can find mines as well."

He frowns, tapping a few more keys to bypass the security systems on 
his future self's internal system's. FZ's systems were almost 
identical to Zardus' own, so Zardus had very little trouble getting 
around them.

"We can use the Alliance base's shields to project underwater," he 
continues his reply to Nemesis, "But in order to do that, we should 
have the Alliance base as close to the surrounding waters as 
possible. Perhaps underground?" 




--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, KSLawdogg@c... wrote:
> Nemesis Enforcer/Scattershot:
> 
> 
> 
> Nemesis Enforcer was deep in thought as he rode a thermal, his eyes 
barely 
> able to take the light.  His animal form was nocturnal, and didn't 
like 
> bright lights!  And that damn star (the Sun) was blazing right into 
his 
> sensetive optic sensors.  When he got back to base, he'd have to do 
something 
> about them.
> 
> He thought a little longer, two thirds of the way to the Iron Fist 
and 
> relocated Alliance Base.  He looked to his right at Scattershot, 
who was 
> chasing a fish near the surface of the water.
> 
> Nemesis sighed at the bald eagle, opening a comlink to Zardus.
> "Zardus, it's Nemesis Enforcer.  I've been thinking about things, 
and I think 
> we need to make a few modifications to the defenses of the island."
> 
> "First, I was wondering if the shields which cover the island go 
all the way 
> down to the bottom of the sea bed?  If not, people could swim under 
the 
> shields and gain access, possible.  Now, to combat that 
possibility, I was 
> thinking making it possible for the shields touch down to the sea 
bed.  Also, 
> we could have underwater mines and torpedo tubes underwater."
> 
> Nemesis awaited for a response, raising in altitude twenty feet, 
not wanting 
> Scattershot to hear him.
